thread.title: LI transgender students, parents speak out on bathroom directive
thread.title_full: LI transgender students, parents speak out on bathroom directive | Newsday

author: Joie Tyrrell
title: LI transgender students, parents speak out on bathroom directive
text:
advertisement | advertise on newsday 
New York LGBT Network CEO David Kilmnick speaks alongside Long Island transgender parents and students at a news conference on Thursday, Feb. 23, 2017, in Woodbury, a day after President Donald Trump's rollback of the Obama-era directive instructing public schools to allow transgender students to use bathrooms and locker rooms. (Credit: Howard Schnapp) 

Long Island transgender students and their parents joined Thursday with the leader of the New York LGBT Network to speak out against President Donald Trump’s rollback of the Obama-era directive instructing public schools to allow transgender students to use bathrooms and locker rooms of their chosen gender.
David Kilmnick, the organization’s chief executive, was with students and parents at...
